title: (x) State of Design Initiative Victoria 2006 tech sans - Gravur Condensed {Marc O, Dominic Forde (self)}
content:
I was hoping someone could ID this typeface for me?

I'm interested in any other rounded fonts that have a stencily/ auto-cad look to them that you can suggest.

Many thanks,

Dom

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621112205/http:/typophile.com/files/sample_21.jpg) | 37.91 KB |
author: Dominic Forde

comments.content:
These are close

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621112205im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Chevin_3926.gif)
Chevin (Veer)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621112205im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Conduit_5876.gif)
ITC Conduit

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621112205im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IsonormRegular_6241.gif)
FF Isonorm 

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design, Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621112205/http:/www.solid-creative.com/motion.htm)

Thanks guys those are a great help.  
The Lineto site has some great stuff!

Cheers,

Dom

The font in my sample was Gravur Condensed available through lineto - apparently it's based on a typeface used on 95% of Swiss letterbox's and doorbells.  
God bless the Swiss.

Excellent choice for an Australian Award then?

:)

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design, Melbourne](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621112205/http:/www.solid-creative.com/motion.htm)

_"rounded fonts that have a stencily/ auto-cad look to them"_

There was a time when we would have said 'look like lettering from a Leroy Lettering set'.

[Vega TV](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621112205/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/vega-tv-sh/) would have been my candidate for a similar face.

- Mike Yanega
